p: The crude root extract of B. antidysenterica showed a dose-dependent response in prolonging the onset of diarrhoea. As shown in Table 1 , the onset of diarrhoea was significantly protracted at doses of 200 and 400 mg/kg as compared to the negative control ( p < 0.001). In addition, the largest test dose has shown maximum prolongation in diarrhoeal onset as compared to the standard drug loperamide 3 mg/kg. Moreover, all test doses of the crude root extract significantly decreased ( p < 0.001) the average number and weight of wet faces as compared to the negative control.
